turns.content: In the year 2030, people do not own anything. This means that they do not own cars, houses, appliances, or clothes. Instead, they have access to transportation, accommodation, food, and other things they need in their daily lives. These things are free, so people do not need to buy them. However, this also means that people have no privacy, as they do not own anything. Despite this, life is still better than it has ever been.

This scenario is highly unlikely. While it is possible that people may not need to own certain things in the future, it is unlikely that everything will be free and available to everyone. This type of system would require a significant overhaul of the current economic and social structures, and it is unclear how it would be sustainable in the long term. Additionally, the lack of privacy that you describe would likely be a major concern for many people. It is important for individuals to have control over their personal belongings and space in order to maintain their autonomy and privacy.
Ownership sounds like very archaic thing

Ownership is a concept that has been around for a long time, and it is deeply ingrained in many societies. The idea of ownership allows individuals to have control over certain things and to have a sense of personal property. This can provide people with security, a sense of belonging, and a way to express themselves. While the concept of ownership may evolve over time, it is unlikely to disappear completely.
